intro: Hartigia milleflora, commonly known as the many-flowered hartigia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and prefers well-drained soil. Its foliage is broad and glossy, often with a slight hairy texture. Hartigia milleflora is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
